structure.unit: B HOUSING, BUILDINGS, AND CONSTRUCTION - BUILDING CODE

text.section:
Applications for examination shall be in writing and shall contain all information required by the board. Applications shall be filed not less than forty-five (45) days prior to the examination date.
Not less than ten (10) days prior to an examination date, the board shall send written notice of the date, hour, and place of the examination to each applicant for licensure or certification.
Each application for licensure or certification shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable application fee.

Examinations shall be given at least two (2) times during each calendar year at those times and places within the Commonwealth prescribed by the board. No applicant may take an examination until the examination fee is paid.
Notice of passing or failing an examination shall be provided to each applicant as soon as practicable.

law.history: Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 59, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1994.
